lines.text: I'm Catholic, Captain. I believe in anything that makes me nervous.
I'm a teenager, it's my job to be hyper!
the ocean. As captain of the SeaQuest and its crew, we are it's guardians, for beneath the surface lies the future.
You're going to fire him out of a torpedo tube?
Noooo, he's going to *swim* out of a torpedo tube.

[pause]
I still don't like it.
So, tell me Captain, how do we beat the SeaQuest?
I've already beaten SeaQuest. What I want, is to be there when she drowns.
I want this boat stopped, right now!
That's impossible, sir. Once we break port, we're commited to the Channel. This isn't exactly a rowboat.
I know what it is, Commander, I designed the damned thing.
If the Captain would like, I could arrange to have a launch craft shuttle you back to Pearl once we hit open water.
The Captain would like!
Yes, sir.
We're only a few kilometers away. We can go back and wait for her to come up.
Come up? She never has to come up. Even in her crippled state she could stay down there for months. No, we're gonna have to draw her out.
We'll need precise specifications of the venting cap assembly.

[taps her on the shoulder]
I think we need a troubleshooter.
A what?
I don't think what's happening on this boat is an accident. I think we need someone to go down into the guts of her computers and look around a bit.
I'm disappointed in you, Marilyn. Four torpedo's fired and only two hits. I thought I tought you better than that.

[on viewscreen]
I'll do better next time. I promise.
There won't be a next time, we both know that. Too many innocent people have died already.

[on viewscreen]
What world are you living in, Nathan? There are no innocent people. Everybody's guilty of something.

[on viewscreen]
You want to kill me don't you? The warrior in you wants to taste a little blood? Isn't that funny? I kill for power. You kill for peace. We're just different sides of the same coin. Each heroes to our own causes. Well, lets see who gets the parade.
